Topic.Title: Which stocks Billionaires Love?

Message.Msg: 2012 was a year that saw Tim Cook put his mark on Apple, Facebook go through growing pains, Microsoft unveil perhaps the biggest product refresh in its history (though the jury's still out on its success), and the "post-PC era" turn into a reality, notes The Verge in its recap of the year's top tech stories. Looking ahead to 2013, it sees Apple overhauling iOS following a bumpy 2012, Google battling with Samsung over Android's future, and Microsoft, Sony, and perhaps Valve trying to invigorate a slumping console gaming industry.

Topic.Title: Ballmer needs to come out and Mention Apps Situation

Message.Msg: Well, mobile phones go to websites designed for mobile phones. That's why a connection to a website is called an app. And so ARM tablets mostly go to websites designed for mobile phones. But a tablet with an Atom processor can go to any website but can also run desktop applications. Here are some Atom tablets: HP Elite Pad 900 Lenovo ThinkPad 2 Samsung ATIV 500T The Samsung ATIV 500T has both WiFi and ethernet connection. The Lenovo ThinkPad 2 has WiFi and USB. The Elite Pad 900 has WiFi while USB is included with the "smart jacket". Then the Elite Pad 900 also offers a "productivity jacket". Of course check the specs carefully before buying.

Message.Title: Prediction: Makes a new High of 50 in 2013
Message.Msg: Here is why?: Sentiment shifts as institutions see MSFT growing in Mobile phone (290% growth) and Tablets. PE expands to 15 to that of S&P500. On 3.30 EPS for 2013 that is 3.30 * 15 = 49.5 (round it to 50). I am sure many on this board will respond to this post with a 22, 16, 10 prediction. That is fine. But mark this post and see what happens in 2013

Topic.Title: Prediction: Makes a new High of 50 in 2013

Message.Msg: Make a new low in 2013: 1. 12 years of no stock growth was the harbinger of bad thing to come. 2. Vista and Zune were the messenger that the end of MSFT as a market leader is coming. 3. iPhone business alone made more revenue and profit than all of MSFT Corp was the beginning of the end. 3. Surface and W8 indicate the end of MSFT is sooner than later.

Message.Title: MSFT will see new lows in 2013
Message.Msg: Here is why: 1. PC sales down with every vendor except for Apple iOS, which is up YOY. 2. PC down means Office sales down by same % 3. Adoption of iOS products in the enterprise accelerating YOY, while Windows is decelerating YOY. 4. MSFT stores are a failing to produce profits.

Message.Title: Microsofts EPS grew 200%+ in the last ten years and still growing
Message.Msg: Office, Server, Xbox all are solid. The only issue was Mobile phone and Tablet OS. With 40M win8 sold in 30days and lkely having sold over 80M+ as of Dec 31st; and likely having sold 2M Surface RT, Windows division may be on a rapid new growth phase. We know Windows phone is growing gangbusters and It is possible it will grab 5% to 10% of entire mobile phone market share next year that is a dramtic growth something like 289% this year and may be 200-300% next year. That is a hyper growth start up like growth
